SEARCH
Package solvers.backtrack

Class BacktrackOptimized

java.lang.Object
solvers.Solver
solvers.backtrack.BacktrackOptimized
public class BacktrackOptimized extends Solver
An optimized implementation of a backtracking Sudoku solver that uses several advanced techniques to improve performance over basic backtracking.

This solver implements the following optimization strategies:

  • Minimum Remaining Values (MRV) heuristic to choose the most constrained cells first
  • Forward checking to detect failures early
  • Hidden singles propagation
  • Caching of possible values for cells

The solver maintains a cache of possible values for each cell to avoid repeated calculations and implements constraint propagation through forward checking and hidden singles detection.

  • Method Details

    • solve

      public void solve()
      Solves the Sudoku puzzle using optimized backtracking with the MRV heuristic.

      This method clears the lastInserts and historyInserts lists before initiating the backtracking process using the Minimum Remaining Values (MRV) heuristic.

      Specified by:
      solve in class Solver

    • getNumberOfSolutions

      public int getNumberOfSolutions()
      Specified by:
      getNumberOfSolutions in class Solver

    • backtrackMinimumRemainingValues

      private boolean backtrackMinimumRemainingValues()
      Performs the optimized backtracking algorithm using the Minimum Remaining Values (MRV) heuristic.
      Returns:
      true if a solution is found, false otherwise.

    • findMostConstrainedCell

      private Position findMostConstrainedCell()
      Finds the most constrained cell in the grid using the MRV heuristic.

      Chooses cells with the fewest possible valid values. In case of ties, it selects cells that are part of more constraints (rules).

      Returns:
      Position of the most constrained cell, or null if no empty cells remain.

    • validateAndPropagate

      private boolean validateAndPropagate(Position currentPos)
      Validates the current move and propagates constraints to related cells.

      Implements a three-level constraint checking system:

      1. Forward checking
      2. Naked pairs elimination (currently disabled)
      3. Hidden singles propagation
      Parameters:
      currentPos - The position of the current move to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid and constraint propagation succeeds, false otherwise.

    • findHiddenSingles

      private Set<Position> findHiddenSingles(Position currentPos)
      Finds hidden singles related to the given position.

      When a new position is updated in the grid, this method checks if affected cells have only one possible value left, which indicates a hidden single.

      Parameters:
      currentPos - The position to find hidden singles related to.
      Returns:
      A set of positions containing hidden singles.

    • isForwardCheckValid

      private boolean isForwardCheckValid(Position currentPos)
      Checks if forward checking is valid for a given position.

      When a new position is updated in the grid, this method checks if any affected cells are left with no possible values. If so, the forward check fails, indicating an invalid state.

      Parameters:
      currentPos - The position to check forward check validity for.
      Returns:
      true if forward check is valid, false otherwise.

    • eliminateNakedPairs

      @Deprecated private void eliminateNakedPairs(Rule rule)
      Deprecated.
      Naked pairs elimination is currently disabled as it is not efficient for small grids.
      Eliminates naked pairs within a given rule.

      This method identifies pairs of cells within a rule that have the same two possible values.

      Parameters:
      rule - The rule to apply naked pairs elimination to.

    • rollBack

      protected void rollBack()
      Rolls back the last move made on the grid and updates the history.

      Invalidates the cache for the position that was rolled back and all related positions.

      Overrides:
      rollBack in class Solver

    • getPossiblePlaysWithCache

      private Set<String> getPossiblePlaysWithCache(Position pos)
      Retrieves the possible values for a given position, using the cache if available.

      If the possible values for the position are not found in the cache, they are calculated using Solver.getPossiblePlays(Position) and then stored in the cache for future use.

      Parameters:
      pos - The position to retrieve possible values for.
      Returns:
      The set of possible values for the given position.
      See Also:
      • Solver.getPossiblePlays(Position)

    • invalidateCache

      private void invalidateCache(Position pos)
      Invalidates the cache for a given position and all related positions.

      This method removes the cached possible values for the specified position and all other positions that are in the same rules as the given position. This ensures that the cache is consistent with the current state of the Sudoku grid after a change.

      Parameters:
      pos - The position to invalidate the cache for.
